description: Synchronizes the specified MFA device with its IAM resource object on the Amazon Web Services servers. For more information about creating and working with virtual MFA devices, see Using a virtual MFA device in the IAM User Guide.

parameters.name: UserName
parameters.description: The name of the user whose MFA device you want to resynchronize. This parameter allows (through its regex pattern) a string of characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters: _+=,.@-

parameters.name: SerialNumber
parameters.description: Serial number that uniquely identifies the MFA device. This parameter allows (through its regex pattern) a string of characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters: _+=,.@-

parameters.name: AuthenticationCode1
parameters.description: An authentication code emitted by the device. The format for this parameter is a sequence of six digits.

parameters.name: AuthenticationCode2
parameters.description: A subsequent authentication code emitted by the device. The format for this parameter is a sequence of six digits.
